page.title: 06 Prehistoric Barham.
page.content: Millions of years ago mammoths roamed the Elham valley floor.Some workmen found two skeletons of mammoths with teeth weighing 11 lbs under the Barham football pitch in 1932.There are the remains of 103 round barrows near Derringstone Hill Farm on the Barham Downs.One tumulus contained beads and a perforated crystal ball.Another one nearby contained the famous Kingston Brooch,now in Liverpool museum.Some mid-bronze age axe heads were found in a newly ploughed field by a twelve year old boy in 1965.They were at least three thousand years old.The A2(T) follows the course of the Roman Watling Street,which ran from Dover to London via Canterbury.It is believed that Julius Caesar's army camped out on Barham Downs on their way to London.Roman coins have been found nearby.
